availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas Phillip Boggess (Muhlenberg Co., Ky, tavern keeper and farmer)

body.p: Muhlenberg County, Kentucky, tavern keeper and farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Delila Boggess on September 5, 1844 in Muhlenberg County. Married to Delila Boggess on September 5, 1844 in Muhlenberg County. Father of John H. Boggess, James B. Boggess, Laura E. Boggess, Ann Boggess, Luro Boggess. Married to Martha W. Boggess on January 23, 1860 in Muhlenberg County. Father of Mary F. Boggess, William Boggess, Dally Boggess. Tavern keeper in Muhlenberg Count in 1850. Farmer in Muhlenberg County in 1860 and 1870. Owned two enslaved persons in Muhlenberg County in 1850.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Muhlenberg County, District 1, p. 222B. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Muhlenberg County, District 2, p. 728. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Muhlenberg County, District 3, p. 74. Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Muhlenberg County, District 1, p. 121.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Muhlenberg County Marriages, Film #000557316, p. 254.
